result.execSummary:
The defendant Mikel J. Koller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for time served, if any, to be determined.
Consecutive to: Sentence now serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Must seek and maintain full-time employment or a combination of employment and education which is satisfactory to your agent, commensurate with his treatment needs.  Defendant  must not leave or change employment without prior approval of your agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

No contact with any known illegal drug users or dealers.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the  agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.

Defendant to submit a DNA sample, if not already submitted.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Bosben.  Parties have both PSI.  No changes noted.  State agrees to probation's recommendation.  15CF13:  8 yrs total. 4 years incarceration, 4 years extended supervision.  15CF157:  4 yrs total.  2 years incarceration, 2 years extended supervision.  Concurrent to each other, consecutive to sentence now serving.  Complete AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommended treatment.  No contact with any known drug users or dealers.  Not to possess or consume alcohol, nor enter any establishment where alcohol is available for consumption on the premises or where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  Pay all Court ordered financial obligations and any other fees deemed appropriate. Cooperate with any other assessment and treatment programming deemed appropriate by the Department of  Corrections.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.  Defense recommended: 4 years initial confinement, 4 years extended supervision,  concurrent.  Or consecutive probation.  Or 4 years initial confinement, with more extended supervision.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  Court ordered:  15CF13: 8  years total. 4  years initial confinement,  4  years extended supervision.  Consecutive to sentencing serving, concurrent to 15CF157.  

15CF157:  4 years total.   2 years initial confinement,   2  years extended supervision. Consecutive to sentence now serving.

Complete AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommended treatment.
No contact with any known drug users or dealers

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Obtain and maintain employment/school,  commensurate with his treatment needs.  Credit for time served, if any, to be determined.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in court, in custody, with Attorney Bosben.  Defendant to plead to count 1 in the amended information.  Dismiss repeater. Granted.  Class F felony.   DRI remaining counts.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties of the charge he is pleading to.  No contest plea entered by the defendant.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Felony warnings given. Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of count 1.  Poss with intent to deliver meth.  Counts 2, 3 and 4 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.   PSI ordered.  Due 2/5/16.  Sentencing set for 2/18/16 at 1:30 pm.  1/2 hour block.
Plea hearing at 12-14-2015 01:30 pm

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant appeared from Jackson County Jail by video with counsel Gina Bosben present in the courtroom.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Attorney Bosben states the defendant is on a P.O. hold and has an ATR; waives reading of the complaint and states a Bail Motion was filed last week.  Requesting a signature bond.  Court states there is a cash bond on a case in Monroe County.  Attorney Bosben states that cash has been posted.  State has no objection to reduce to signature bond.  Court orders cash bond reduced to a $2000 signature bond with prior conditions.  Attorney Bosben states the time limits will be waived for the preliminary hearing and requests a status hearing.  Judge reviewed the waiver of time limits with defendant and accepts waiver.  The Court sets a pre-trial for 4-1 and a status conference for 4-20-15 at 3:00.  Attorney Bosben may call in for the status hearing.

Pre-trial conference at 04-01-2015 09:00 am.
Status conference at 04-20-2015 03:00 pm.
